title: Optimization of "Powerful Tools for Caregivers" of Dementia Patients
description_brief: The purpose of this study is to examine if a psycho-educational intervention for caregivers of patients with dementia will decrease caregiver burden, increase caregiver physical activity, and decrease the reporting of behavioral and psychological symptoms of the person with dementia.
explanation_target: Reason: The described trial tests a psycho-educational intervention for caregivers (the "Powerful Tools for Caregivers" program) with the stated aims of decreasing caregiver burden, increasing caregiver physical activity, and decreasing reporting of behavioral and psychological symptoms in the person with dementia. This is a non-pharmacologic, caregiver-focused intervention intended to reduce behavioral/psychiatric manifestations and caregiver distress rather than to modify Alzheimer’s pathology or directly enhance cognition. citeturn0search2turn0search1

Act: Key extracted details — Intervention: Powerful Tools for Caregivers (PTC), a manualized 6-week group psychoeducational program for family caregivers delivered by trained leaders; Intended effects: reduce caregiver stress/burden, improve self-care and coping, and reduce behavioral and psychological symptoms of dementia (BPSD) reporting in care recipients. No drug or placebo is involved; this is a behavioral/educational trial. citeturn0search4turn0search2turn0search1
